    Helper classes for reading the ops from an InputStream.
    FSEditLogOp.AddBlockOp 
    FSEditLogOp.AddCacheDirectiveInfoOp
    @AtMostOnce for ClientProtocol.addCacheDirective(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.CacheDirectiveInfo, java.util.EnumSet<org.apache.hadoop.fs.CacheFlag>)
    FSEditLogOp.AddCachePoolOp
    @AtMostOnce for ClientProtocol.addCachePool(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.CachePoolInfo)
    FSEditLogOp.AddCloseOp 
    FSEditLogOp.AddOp
    @AtMostOnce for ClientProtocol.create(java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.io.EnumSetWritable<org.apache.hadoop.fs.CreateFlag>, boolean, short, long, org.apache.hadoop.crypto.CryptoProtocolVersion[]) and ClientProtocol.append(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.io.EnumSetWritable<org.apache.hadoop.fs.CreateFlag>)
    FSEditLogOp.AllocateBlockIdOp
    @Idempotent for ClientProtocol.addBlock(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.ExtendedBlock, org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.DatanodeInfo[], long, java.lang.String[])
    FSEditLogOp.AllowSnapshotOp
    Operation corresponding to allow creating snapshot on a directory
    FSEditLogOp.AppendOp 
    FSEditLogOp.BlockListUpdatingOp 
    FSEditLogOp.CancelDelegationTokenOp
    @Idempotent for ClientProtocol.cancelDelegationToken(org.apache.hadoop.security.token.Token<org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.security.token.delegation.DelegationTokenIdentifier>)
    FSEditLogOp.ClearNSQuotaOp 
    FSEditLogOp.CloseOp
    Although ClientProtocol.append(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.io.EnumSetWritable<org.apache.hadoop.fs.CreateFlag>) may also log a close op, we do not need to record the rpc ids here since a successful appendFile op will finally log an AddOp.
    FSEditLogOp.ConcatDeleteOp
    @AtMostOnce for ClientProtocol.concat(java.lang.String, java.lang.String[])
    FSEditLogOp.CreateSnapshotOp
    Operation corresponding to creating a snapshot.
    FSEditLogOp.DeleteOp
    @AtMostOnce for ClientProtocol.delete(java.lang.String, boolean)
    FSEditLogOp.DeleteSnapshotOp
    Operation corresponding to delete a snapshot.
    FSEditLogOp.DisallowSnapshotOp
    Operation corresponding to disallow creating snapshot on a directory

    FSEditLogOp.SetAclOp 
    FSEditLogOp.SetGenstampV1Op
    The corresponding operations are either @Idempotent ( ClientProtocol.updateBlockForPipeline(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.ExtendedBlock, java.lang.String), ClientProtocol.recoverLease(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), ClientProtocol.addBlock(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.ExtendedBlock, org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.DatanodeInfo[], long, java.lang.String[])) or already bound with other editlog op which records rpc ids ( ClientProtocol.create(java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission, java.lang.String, org.apache.hadoop.io.EnumSetWritable<org.apache.hadoop.fs.CreateFlag>, boolean, short, long, org.apache.hadoop.crypto.CryptoProtocolVersion[])).

    Manages a collection of Journals.
    JournalSet.JournalAndStream
    Container for a JournalManager paired with its currently active stream.
    JournalSet.JournalClosure
    Implementations of this interface encapsulate operations that can be iteratively applied on all the journals.
    LeaseExpiredException
    The lease that was being used to create this file has expired.
    LeaseManager
    LeaseManager does the lease housekeeping for writing on files.
    LeaseManager.Lease
    A Lease governs all the locks held by a single client.

    Interface used to abstract over classes which manage edit logs that may need to be purged.

    Exception thrown when the user has requested processing to stop.

    Caches frequently used names to facilitate reuse.

    Class for tracking use count of a name
    NameNode
    NameNode serves as both directory namespace manager and "inode table" for the Hadoop DFS.

    Class used to expose NameNode as context to HAState
    NameNode.OperationCategory
    Categories of operations supported by the namenode.
    NamenodeFsck.Result
    FsckResult of checking, plus overall DFS statistics.
    NameNodeHttpServer
    Encapsulates the HTTP server started by the NameNode.
    NameNodeLayoutVersion.Feature
    Enums for features that change the layout version.
    NameNodeMXBean
    This is the JMX management interface for namenode information
    NameNodeResourceChecker
    NameNodeResourceChecker provides a method - hasAvailableDiskSpace - which will return true if and only if the NameNode has disk space available on all required volumes, and any volume which is configured to be redundant.
    NameNodeResourceChecker.CheckedVolume 
    NameNodeRpcServer
    This class is responsible for handling all of the RPC calls to the NameNode.
    NameNodeStatusMXBean
    This is the JMX management interface for NameNode status information
    Namesystem
    Namesystem operations.
    NNStorage
    NNStorage is responsible for management of the StorageDirectories used by the NameNode.
    NNStorage.NameNodeDirType
    Implementation of StorageDirType specific to namenode storage A Storage directory could be of type IMAGE which stores only fsimage, or of type EDITS which stores edits or of type IMAGE_AND_EDITS which stores both fsimage and edits.
    NNStorage.NameNodeFile 
    NNStorageRetentionManager
    The NNStorageRetentionManager is responsible for inspecting the storage directories of the NN and enforcing a retention policy on checkpoints and edit logs.
    NNStorageRetentionManager.StoragePurger
    Interface responsible for disposing of old checkpoints and edit logs.
    Quota

    Quota.Counts

    A generic abstract class to support reading edits log data from persistent storage.
    FSEditLogOp
    Helper classes for reading the ops from an InputStream.
    FSEditLogOp.OpInstanceCache 
    FSEditLogOpCodes
    Op codes for edits file
